meanings.definition: A range of frequencies in a signal that are attenuated or blocked.
meanings.sent1: The stopband of the radio signal was where the unwanted noise was silenced.
meanings.sent2: The stopband of the music player prevented any high-pitched sounds from coming through.
meanings.sent3: The stopband of the TV broadcast made the show sound like a whisper in a loud room.
meanings.sent4: Her silence acted as a stopband, muting out any unnecessary chatter around her.
meanings.sent5: The stopband in the classroom made it easier for the students to focus on their work.

meanings.definition: The portion of a filter's frequency response where little or no signal is allowed to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The stopband of the filter blocked out the unwanted frequencies effectively.
meanings.sent2: In the stopband of the equalizer, only a faint hum could be heard.
meanings.sent3: The stopband of the speaker seemed to have a mind of its own, muffling certain sounds.
meanings.sent4: The stopband of the amplifier acted like a gatekeeper, allowing only specific frequencies to pass.
meanings.sent5: The stopband of the headphones created a barrier against the loud noises of the city.
